definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: At this time of the year farmers to capalternating currentity to plow their fields.

sentences.english: Yili area is one of the most abundant protected area in Xinjiang province.

sentences.english: So far, in Xinjiang, Yi Li area still protogenesis walnut forest having large area.

sentences.english: HEIFER saw an Ox hard at work harnessed to a plow.

sentences.english: At this time of the year flimamount tors for you to plow their fields.

sentences.english: You have to plough fields before you plant seeds.

sentences.english: We will plow the field soon after the last frost.

sentences.english: A farmer must plow the land before planting crops.

sentences.english: No farmer ever plowed a field by running it over in his mind.

sentences.english: For this purpose he uses the bull to plough and the manure to fertilize.

sentences.english: I have decided to adopt the method of tilling deeply with twin plows .

sentences.english: At this time of the year ftricepers in order to plow their fields.

definition: to harrow/to break the ground with a hoe
to put one's hand to the plow
to thresh or husk grain on a threshing ground (dialect)
